::English::

Title: Across 110th Street 
Year: 1972
Genre: Thriller
Country: United States
Format: Color
Duration: 102 minutes
Director: Barry Shear
Actors: Anthony Quinn, Yaphet Kotto, Anthony Franciosa, Paul Benjamin, Ed Bernard, Richard Ward, Norma Donaldson, Antonio Fargas
Production: Fouad Said / Ralph B. Serpe
Screenwriter: Luther Davis / Wally Ferris (novel)
Photo: Jack Priestley
Music: J.J. Johnson
World Premiere: 19-Dec-1972

Synopsis
Panic in the street 110, a performance film as effective as a street scam, strikes the viewer with a full chilling journey full of violence and action by the more sinister streets of Harlem.
Anthony Quinn, cold as ice, heads a top-notch cast, which also include Anthony Franciosa and Yaphet Kotto in this thriller, savage, violent and startling realism on a bloody vendetta.
A group of black gangsters armed to the teeth trying to grab business from the mafia in the neighborhood of Harlem, but his plans will explode in their faces, not just figuratively. The bullets rained, honest policemen are killed doing their duty, and two stars from the body (Quinn and Kotto) are forced to work together to restore peace and justice to the streets before the Mafia sweep away? The ghetto? With the mafia and the police on his heels, these thugs in Harlem is probably not more than one way to return to their lairs ... With feet first!
